DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose study 1. determine whether dental implant engage alveolar crest cortical bone sinus floor use vertical stopper drill self-threading concept ( bi-cortical fixation ) increase initial implant stability compare short implant engage alveolar crest cortical bone ( uni-cortical fixation ) and/or one engage crest sinus floor green stick fracture ( indirect sinus lift technique ) , 2. study whether different surgical technique , residual bone height , bone density , length width implant use affect initial implant stability posterior maxilla . In addition , study continue 3. compare secondary implant stability implant fix bi-cortically , uni-cortically indirect sinus lift technique 2nd stage surgery/6 month heal 1 year follow-up restoration 4. measure amount endo-sinus bone formation 1- year follow CT ( computer tomogram ) scan evaluate safety potential post-operative complication bi-cortical fixation indirect sinus lift technique report throughout follow period .
DOC.brief_title: Initial Stability Posterior Maxillary Implants With Bicortical Fixation
DOC.detailed_description: The clinical trial evaluate initial implant stability primary outcome measure resonance frequency analysis ( RFA ) employ dental implant surgically place posterior maxillary bone engage alveolar crest sinus floor use vertical stopper drill self-threading concept ( bi-cortical fixation ) , engage alveolar crest ( uni-cortical fixation ) , engage alveolar crest sinus floor use indirect sinus lift technique ( indirect sinus lift technique ) . The surgical procedure compare experiment include 3 group : - Group 1 ( 15 implant ) Short implant place proximity sinus without sinus floor involvement ( unicortical fixation ) - Group 2 ( 15 implant ) Implants place use indirect sinus lift technique ( indirect sinus lift technique ) - Group 3 ( 15 implant ) Bi-cortically fixed implant intentionally engage sinus floor beyond 1-2mm without graft use stopper drill self-threading concept ( bi-cortical fixation )
DOC.criteria: Eligible volunteer must least 18 year old , partially edentulous maxillary posterior region 711 mm residual bone height sinus floor indicate CBCT scan diagnosis treatment planning , medical risk ASA I II classification participate . Patients bone pathology , sinus infection , pregnant exclude . Implants require tapping , site implant replacement , implant dehiscence and/or fenestration exclude .
